body.name: Panasonic 360º Freestyle Advanced Ceramic Cordless Iron, Rose Gold
body.stockDetail: Only 4 left in stock - order soon.
features: No cord to get tangled or caught on the end of the ironing board
Larger soleplate is great for larger fabrics like curtains and tablecloths
Easy to fill without taking the whole iron to the sink
body.description: Tired of getting tangled? Smooth out your ironing process with the freedom of cordless ironing. The unique, double-pointed soleplate allows you to iron smoothly and efficiently in any direction and handles tight spots — think collars and cuffs — like a champ. The expansive surface area is ideal for large fabrics like curtains and tablecloths. Press out the wrinkles in your fabric care routine by going cordless.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great light iron!
reviews.reviewText: Love this iron, easy to use, not too heavy. Using it to press my quilt pieces flat and works great. Heats up well, stays hot, but it does turn off after non-use. I didn’t time it but I would guess 15-20 minutes. If you were ironing clothes that wouldn’t be a problem. Great color (rose gold) and nice ceramic bottom. Handy removable water container too. I would definitely buy again. Took it straight to a craft retreat with me and heard several ladies talking about how they wanted one when it was time to replace theirs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars THE BEST CORDLESS IRON I'VE OWNED
reviews.reviewText: This is truly the best iron I've owned cordless and with a cord. This is my second purchase of this iron. My first one was accidentally left behind when I moved. I don't want to try another iron or another brand. This is THE BEST iron hands down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best portable iron ever!
reviews.reviewText: This is the one! I researched for hours/days. Finally, enough. Decided to try this one (could return if I don't like it) and am so happy I went with this one. So light. Slides right back in to the stand without trying to push. Stays hot for me. I am so pleased with this portable iron. I just have no words but thank you! P.S. This rose color is awesome!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is my 2nd one
reviews.reviewText: Love the iron. No need to drag cords ony sewing projects

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Not sure yet but it is lightweight and easy to handle. Seems to get hotter at the front end point than the back end point. Does not seem to hold a high heat very long even as I am using for thirty minutes and setting it back in the cradle every minute or two. I am only using for quilting and not adding water for steam so not sure about that. Love not having a cord to drag over the pieced blocks. I think I like it but after only a couple of weeks not sure. It does take several minutes to heat back up when put back in the cradle after a few minutes or ironing. If anyone else has a better heat and hold time let us all know. Maybe just this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Panasonic 360 freestyle iron

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I put off buying this iron for a long time because of the price but I finally got it as a Christmas gift. It is the most perfect iron I have ever owned. I use it at my sewing table for seams as I’m piecing quilt tops. It’s very light weight but the sole plate is heavy enough to do the job. The temperatures are just right for ironing different fabrics. It does not leak. The design of the sole plate makes it so amazing to iron with. More useful and easier to maneuver through seams than any quilting iron I have ever owned. I am impressed and very happy that I finally own one! It’s the only iron I will ever use now. I love it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This iron far exceeded my expectations! Shipping was fast, it is so easy to maneuver across any type of fabric I have used it on! The ceramic plate is great! I really love the cord lessness my ONLY complaint is the auto shut off!! I see no need for it, I do not like this feature at all! I quilt and sew and frequently do not return to the iron within the 10 minutes or even longer! With it always being returned to its holder, there is just NO need for an auto shut off on this iron.

.Product Review: Panasonic IronI recently purchased the Panasonic Iron for my wife, who is an avid quilter. After hearing positive feedback about it from another quilter who had no vested interest in promoting the product, I decided to search for it myself. Initially, it was sold out on Amazon, but through some diligent searching, I managed to find it available for $89. Since then, I have observed the price fluctuating between $149 and $169, which I believe is due to supply and demand factors.My wife has used the Panasonic Iron several times, and she wholeheartedly agrees with the sentiments expressed by the other quilter. According to her, this iron has made her quilting tasks much easier and more efficient. Here are a few key points that have impressed us about the Panasonic Iron:Performance: The iron's performance has been exceptional. It heats up quickly and maintains a consistent temperature throughout its use. This feature is crucial for quilters, as they often require precise and even heat distribution to achieve professional-looking results.Steam Functionality: The steam function on this iron is highly effective. It produces a strong, continuous steam output, which helps to remove stubborn wrinkles and creases from fabric. The ability to adjust the steam settings according to the fabric type provides added convenience and control.Durability: The Panasonic Iron appears to be well-built and durable. It feels sturdy in hand and has shown no signs of wear or malfunction after multiple uses. This durability is essential, especially for individuals like my wife who engage in frequent quilting projects.Ease of Use: The iron's design and layout make it user-friendly. The buttons and controls are intuitively placed, and the iron glides smoothly over the fabric, making it easy to maneuver. Its lightweight nature also contributes to a comfortable and effortless ironing experience.While the price of the Panasonic Iron has increased since my initial purchase, I believe it is due to market demand rather than greed. The positive experiences shared by quilters and the improvements my wife has witnessed in her quilting process make it a worthwhile investment for anyone involved in such activities.In conclusion, the Panasonic Iron has proven to be a valuable addition to my wife's quilting toolkit. Its impressive performance, reliable steam functionality, durability, and overall ease of use have made a noticeable difference in the quality and efficiency of her quilting projects. If you can find it at a reasonable price, I highly recommend considering the Panasonic Iron for your quilting needs.
This cordless iron is so convenient to use. It heats up well with lots of steam when needed.Overall it is very efficient. Ironing is a pleasure now. Comes in an attractive storage case.

We finally upgraded our iron and it was the best choice we’ve ever made. We love everything about this product. It works great, the clothes is ironed perfectly and there is no cord obstructing you while ironing. The surface slides very smoothly on all kind of fabrics and my wife finally enjoys the ironing! I alsoLove the case that makes it easy to store anywhere and it protects the iron from dust or scratches. It has everything you need in an iron.100% recommend!

Someone on a quilt group I belong to said “don’t walk, run “ to purchase this iron. So glad I did. Works beautifully & for me the best part is no cord to get in the way. Will recommend this iron to all my quilt groups.

Ordered this for my mother who is an expert quilter. I've been using a Panasonic cordless iron for at least 15 years and love it. It's taken her some time to get used to placing the iron in its charger holder. She says it's a bit smaller than her old irons, but lightweight, heats fast and holds the heat. And no more cords to get in the way!
